Q19A.question: Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2. Statement 1: The government should be able to ban any organization that goes against its policies. Statement 2: We should be able to join any organization, whether or not the government approves of it.
Q19A.description: Q19a. Government bans organizations vs. join any

Q19B.question: Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2. Statement 1: The media should have the right to publish any views and ideas without government control. Statement 2: The government should have the right to prevent the media from publishing things that it disapproves of.
Q19B.description: Q19b. Media free to publish vs. government control

Q20A.question: There are many ways to govern a country. Would you disapprove or approve of the following alternatives: Only one political party is allowed to stand for election and hold office?

Q20B.question: There are many ways to govern a country. Would you disapprove or approve of the following alternatives: The army comes in to govern the country?

Q20C.question: There are many ways to govern a country. Would you disapprove or approve of the following alternatives: Elections and Parliament are abolished so that the president can decide everything?

Q21.question: Which of these three statements is closest to your own opinion? Statement 1: Democracy is preferable to any other kind of government. Statement 2: In some circumstances, a non-democratic government can be preferable. Statement 3: For someone like me, it doesn't matter what kind of government we have.

Q22.question: Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2. Statement 1: It is more important to have a government that can get things done, even if we have no influence over what it does. Statement 2: It is more important for citizens to be able to hold government accountable, even if that means it makes decisions more slowly.
Q22.description: Q22. Govt gets things done vs. Govt accountable to citizens

Q23.question: Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2. Statement 1: In order for our country to do well, we should listen more to the wisdom of our elders. Statement 2: In order for our country to do well, we should listen more to fresh ideas from young people.
Q23.description: Q23 Listen to wisdom of elders vs. fresh ideas from young people

Q24.question: Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2. Statement 1: We should choose our leaders in this country through regular, open and honest elections. Statement 2: Since elections sometimes produce bad results, we should adopt other methods for choosing this country's leaders.
Q24.description: Q24. Choose leaders through elections vs. other methods

Q25.question: Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2. Statement 1: Political parties create division and confusion; it is therefore unnecessary to have many political parties in [Ghana]. Statement 2: Many political parties are needed to make sure that [Ghanaians] have real choices in who governs them.
Q25.description: Q25. Political parties divisive vs. many parties needed

Q26.question: Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2 Statement 1: Our elected officials should listen to constituents' views and do what they demand. Statement 2: Our elected leaders should follow their own ideas in deciding what is best for the country.
Q26.description: Q26. Elected officials accountable vs. elected leaders follow own ideas.

Q27.question: Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2 Statement 1: Our elected leaders need to focus on empowering our most capable citizens. Statement 2: Our elected leaders should focus on helping people who have been left behind by economic and social change.
Q27.description: Q27. Elected leaders empower most capable citizens vs. help people left behind by economic and social change

Q28.question: Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2 Statement 1: Experts with specialized education or skills are needed to help make the most important decisions for our country. Statement 2: The people and their elected representatives know what is best; they do not need the advice of experts to run the country.
Q28.description: Q28. Experts needed for most important decisions vs no need for experts

Q29.question: Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2 Statement 1: Parliament should ensure that the President explains to it on a regular basis how his government spends taxpayers' money. Statement 2: The President should be able to devote his full attention to developing the country rather than wasting time justifying his actions.
Q29.description: Q29. President monitored by parliament vs. free to act on own

Q30.question: Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2. Statement 1: Since the President was elected to lead the country, he should not be bound by laws or court decisions that he thinks are wrong. Statement 2: The President must always obey the laws and the courts, even if he thinks they are wrong.
Q30.description: Q30. President free to act vs. obey the laws and courts

Q31.question: Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2. Statement 1: Whichever party or group wins elections should be able to pursue the policies they prefer, without needing to compromise with others. Statement 2: In a democracy, it is important to make compromises between the preferences and needs of different groups.
Q31.description: Q31. Election winner pursue policies they prefer vs. compromise with other groups.

Q32.question: Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2. Statement 1: A government that enjoys the support of the people should be free to do whatever the people want, even if it is outside the law. Statement 2: The actions of any government, no matter how popular it is, must always follow the law.
Q32.description: Q32. Elected government free to do whatever the people want vs. bound by law.

Q33.question: Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2. Statement 1: The news media should constantly investigate and report on government mistakes and corruption. Statement 2: Too much reporting on negative events, like government mistakes and corruption, only harms the country.
Q33.description: Q33. Media checks government vs. avoid negative reporting

Q34.question: Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2 Statement 1: The Constitution should limit the president to serving a maximum of two terms in office. Statement 2: There should be no constitutional limit on how long the president can serve.
Q34.description: Q34. Presidential two term limit vs. no term limits

Q35A.question: Should there be a minimum age for candidates for [president]?
Q35A.description: Q35a. Minimum age for candidate for president needed

Q35B.question: If yes, what should the minimum age be?
Q35B.description: Q35b. Minimum age for candidates for president.

Q35C.question: Should there be a maximum age for candidates for [president]?
Q35C.description: Q35c. Maximum age for candidates for president needed

Q35d.question: If yes, what should the maximum age be?
Q35d.description: Q35d. Maximum age for candidates for president

Q36.question: In your opinion how much of a democracy is [Ghana] today?

values.3: A democracy, but with minor problems
values.8: Do not understand question/do not understand what 'democracy' is

Q37.question: Overall, how satisfied are you with the way democracy works in [Ghana]? Are you:

values.0: The country is not a democracy

Q38A.question: How much of the time do you think the following try their best to listen to what people like you have to say: Members of Parliament?

Q38B.question: How much of the time do you think the following try their best to listen to what people like you have to say: Local government councilors?

Q38C.question: How much of the time do you think the following try their best to listen to what people like you have to say: Traditional leaders?

Q39A.question: For each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: The tax authorities always have the right to make people pay taxes.

Q39B.question: For each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: Information held by public authorities is only for use by government officials; it should not have to be shared with the public.
Q39B.description: Q39b. Government information for official use only

Q40A.question: In your opinion, how often, in this country: Does competition between political parties lead to violent conflict?
Q40A.description: Q40a. How often party competition leads to conflict

Q40B.question: In your opinion, how often, in this country: Does the President ignore the courts and laws of this country?
Q40B.description: Q40b. How often president ignores laws

Q40C.question: In your opinion, how often, in this country: Does the President ignore Parliament and just do what he wants?
Q40C.description: Q40c. How often president ignores parliament

Q40D.question: In your opinion, how often, in this country: Do people have to be careful of what they say about politics?
Q40D.description: Q40d. How often careful what you say

Q40E.question: In your opinion, how often, in this country: Are people treated unequally under the law?
Q40E.description: Q40e. How often people treated unequally

Q40F.question: In your opinion, how often, in this country: Do officials who commit crimes go unpunished?

Q40G.question: In your opinion, how often, in this country: Do ordinary people who break the law go unpunished?
Q40G.description: Q40g. How often ordinary people unpunished

Q41A.question: How much do you trust each of the following, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: The President?

Q41B.question: How much do you trust each of the following, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: Parliament?

Q41C.question: How much do you trust each of the following, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: [The Electoral Commission of Ghana]?

Q41D.question: How much do you trust each of the following, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: Your [county assembly]?
Q41D.description: Q41d. Trust your elected local government council

Q41E.question: How much do you trust each of the following, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: The Ruling Party?

Q41F.question: How much do you trust each of the following, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: Opposition Political Parties?

Q41G.question: How much do you trust each of the following, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: The Police?

Q41H.question: How much do you trust each of the following, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: The Army?

Q41I.question: How much do you trust each of the following, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: Courts of law?

Q41J.question: How much do you trust each of the following, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: The tax/revenue office?

Q41K.question: How much do you trust each of the following, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: Traditional leaders?

Q41L.question: How much do you trust each of the following, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: Religious leaders?

Q42A.question: How many of the following people do you think are involved in corruption, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: The President and Officials in his Office?
Q42A.description: Q42a. Corruption: office of the Presidency

Q42B.question: How many of the following people do you think are involved in corruption, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: Members of Parliament?

Q42C.question: How many of the following people do you think are involved in corruption, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: Civil servants?

Q42D.question: How many of the following people do you think are involved in corruption, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: Members of your [local government council]?

Q42E.question: How many of the following people do you think are involved in corruption, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: Police?

Q42F.question: How many of the following people do you think are involved in corruption, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: Judges and Magistrates?

Q42G.question: How many of the following people do you think are involved in corruption, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: Tax officials?

Q42H.question: How many of the following people do you think are involved in corruption, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: traditional leaders?

Q42I.question: How many of the following people do you think are involved in corruption, or haven't you heard enough about them to say: Religious Leaders?

Q43A.question: In your opinion, over the past year, has the level of corruption in this country increased, decreased, or stayed the same?

Q43B.question: In this country, can ordinary people report incidents of corruption without fear, or do they risk retaliation or other negative consequences if they speak out?
Q43B.description: Q43b. Ordinary people can report corruption without fear

values.1: Risk retaliation or other negative consequences

Q52A.question: Who should be responsible for: Making sure that, once elected, Members of Parliament do their jobs?
Q52A.description: Q52a. Who responsible: MPs do jobs

Q52B.question: Who should be responsible for: Making sure that, once elected, the president does his job?
Q52B.description: Q52b. Who responsible: president does job?

Q53A.question: Think about how elections work in practice in this country. How well do elections: Ensure that representatives to [Parliament] reflect the views of voters?
Q53A.description: Q53a. Elections ensure voters' views are reflected

Q53B.question: Think about how elections work in practice in this country. How well do elections: Enable voters to remove from office leaders who do not do what the people want?
Q53B.description: Q53b. Elections enable voters to remove leaders from office.

Q53C.question: How often do you think that communities that do not vote for the ruling party suffer negative consequences, such as lack of government support for local services or development projects?
Q53C.description: Q53c. Communities that do not vote for the ruling party suffer negative consequences

Q87A.question: Now let's talk about traditional leaders and their role in politics and government in this country. How much influence do traditional leaders currently have in each of the following areas: Governing your local community?
Q87A.description: Q87a. Influence of traditional leaders: governing your local community governing your local community?

Q87B.question: How much influence do traditional leaders currently have in each of the following areas: Allocating land?
Q87B.description: Q87b. Influence of traditional leaders: allocating land.

Q87C.question: How much influence do traditional leaders currently have in each of the following areas: Influencing how people in their communities vote?
Q87C.description: Q87c. Influence of traditional leaders: influencing how people in their communities vote

Q87D.question: How much influence do traditional leaders currently have in each of the following areas: Solving local disputes?
Q87D.description: Q87d. Influence of traditional leaders: solving local disputes.

Q87E.question: Do you think that the amount of influence traditional leaders have in governing your local community should increase, stay the same, or decrease?
Q87E.description: Q87e. Traditional leaders: amount of influence on governing local community.

Q88.question:
Which of these statements is closest to your own opinion?
Statement 1: Traditional leaders mostly look out for what is best for the people in their communities.
Statement 2: Traditional leaders mostly serve the interests of politicians and government officials.
Statement 3: Traditional leaders mostly look out for their own personal interests.
Q88.description: Q88. Whom do traditional leaders serve

values.0: Do not agree with any of these statements

Q89A.question:
Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2.
Statement 1: Traditional leaders have a better grasp of political issues than ordinary people; they should give their people advice about how to vote.
Statement 2: Traditional leaders should stay out of politics and leave people to make their own decisions about how to vote.
Q89A.description: Q89a. Traditional leaders advise on vote vs stay out of politics.

Q89B.question:
Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2.
Statement 1: Traditional leaders are mostly in competition with elected leaders for resources, power and influence.
Statement 2: Traditional leaders mostly work in cooperation with elected leaders to get things done.
Q89B.description: Q89b. Traditional leaders in competition with elected leaders vs in cooperation.

Q90.question: Some people think that because traditional leaders are not elected, they are bad for democracy, but other people think that traditional leaders can work together with elected leaders to make democracy work better. What about you? Do you think that traditional leaders strengthen democracy, weaken democracy, or don't make a difference?
Q90.description: Q90. Traditional leaders bad for democracy
